N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 127.7 - Acceptable forms of performance security

State Regulations

In order to ensure the completion of work allowed under a
highway work permit or annual permit issued pursuant to Parts 125, 126, 129, 131 and 134 of this Title, and to ensure that the State highway is restored to
the condition it was in before permitted work was undertaken without any liens
or encumbrances, performance and payment security is required. Forms of
performance security acceptable to the department are as follows: (a) A cash deposit in funds of the United

States paid to the permitting office. (b) A performance/payment bond in a form
prescribed by the department. (c) A
letter of credit issued by any bank authorized to do business in the State of

New York. Notes
